climbs.name: Misty Mountain Hop
climbs.fa: Carey Zumpano, Ken Low, Greg Eslick 1990

content.description: Fun route that wanders around through a couple a couple of small overhangs/bulges on good quality rock.
content.protection: 4 protection bolts plus 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: This route is on  the south (right side) of the  corridor behind Big Marmot Rock.

content.description: Climb up a small boulder to the base of a water chute and a bolt.  Follow the water chute up to another bolt. After the second bolt the climbing gets low angle and easier.  From here continue up on top of the "marmot"'s head to the anchor.
content.protection:
2 bolts plus new ASCA 2 bolt anchor with chains and quicklinks.

The Rubine and Young guide book both show a 3rd bolt that protects the last 15 feet of climbing to the anchor. It appears that this bolt is now missing. The climbing at this point is probably low 5th class.

content.description:
Follows 4 bolts up the face, then traverses left past another bolt along a ramp to the top of the formation. Two chains for lowering off up top. Shares the anchors of

Marmot with a Hand Grenade

.
content.protection: Bolts of varying ages.  The leeper hanger on the second bolt is special.
content.location:
Starts on the green scooped out face to the right of the M

armot with a Hand Grenade

chimney and right of a small bush.

content.description: 3 bolts up the arete, traverse left along the ridge to anchors. Fun climb if you are in the area. A stick clip for the first bolt is nice.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: On the small buttress to climbers left (east) of Marmot Rocks
